title: Relative Permeability Data Schema
description: Relative permeability is the ratio of a secondary phase (gas, oil, or water) to a reference permeability (usually absolute permeability). This experiment can be conducted at varying saturations of the secondary fluid phase or at a single irreducible saturation of the second phase.

InitialConditions.title: Initial Conditions
InitialConditions.description: The initial conditions of permeability, saturation, and flow rate within the sample.

EffectivePermeability.title: Effective Permeability
EffectivePermeability.description: A measure of how easily fluids can flow through a porous sample, taking into consideration the saturation, presence of other fluids, and the interactions between those fluids into account.

PermeabilityTypeID.title: Permeability Type ID
PermeabilityTypeID.description: The type of permeability being measured, e.g. Gas, PulseDecay, Klinkenberg.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used in determining effective permeability.

RelativePermeability.title: Relative Permeability
RelativePermeability.description: Relative permeability is a measure of how easily a particular fluid can flow through a porous medium when other fluids are also present.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used in determining relative permeability.

Saturation.title: Saturation
Saturation.description: At the start of the experiment, the extent to which pore space within the sample is filled with fluids.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used for this saturation.

SaturationTypeID.title: Saturation Type ID
SaturationTypeID.description: Identifies the area of focus for this saturation measurement, e.g. 'End Face' or 'Average'

LastFlowRate.title: Last Flow Rate
LastFlowRate.description: The last recorded flow rate prior to the experiment.

TestTemperature.title: Test Temperature
TestTemperature.description: The recorded temperature within the test environment.

NetConfiningStress.title: Net Confining Stress
NetConfiningStress.description: The pressure exerted on a sample from its environment, minus the pore pressure within the sample.

OverburdenPressure.title: Overburden Pressure
OverburdenPressure.description: The pressure exerted by the weight of the overlying rock and soil layers on the rock sample being tested.

PorePressure.title: Pore Pressure
PorePressure.description: The pressure exerted by fluids (such as water or oil) within the pores and fractures of a rock sample.

FlowDirection.title: Flow Direction
FlowDirection.description: Direction of flow for the experiment, e.g. "Vertical from bottom".

TerminalConditions.title: Terminal Conditions
TerminalConditions.description: The permeability and saturation conditions of the sample at the end of the experiment.

EffectivePermeability.title: Effective Permeability
EffectivePermeability.description: A measure of how easily fluids can flow through a porous sample, taking into consideration the saturation, presence of other fluids, and the interactions between those fluids into account.

PermeabilityTypeID.title: Permeability Type ID
PermeabilityTypeID.description: The type of permeability being measured, e.g. Gas, PulseDecay, Klinkenberg.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used in determining effective permeability.

RelativePermeability.title: Relative Permeability
RelativePermeability.description: Relative permeability is a measure of how easily a particular fluid can flow through a porous medium when other fluids are also present.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used in determining relative permeability.

Saturation.title: Saturation
Saturation.description: At the end of the experiment, the extent to which pore space within the sample is filled with fluids.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used for this saturation.

SaturationTypeID.title: Saturation Type ID
SaturationTypeID.description: Identifies the area of focus for this saturation measurement, e.g. 'End Face' or 'Average'

RelativePermeabilityCrossover.title: Relative Permeability Crossover
RelativePermeabilityCrossover.description: The relative permeability value of a crossover point in a relative permeability x saturation analysis graph.

EndFaceSaturationCrossover.title: End Face Saturation Crossover
EndFaceSaturationCrossover.description: The saturation value of a crossover point in a relative permeability x saturation analysis graph.

ReferencePermeability.title: Reference Permeability
ReferencePermeability.description: e.g. gas permeability kg, gas permeability at minimum liquid saturation kg@Slmin, oil permeability ko, water permeability kw, etc

items.title: Reference Permeability
items.description: e.g. gas permeability kg, gas permeability at minimum liquid saturation kg@Slmin, oil permeability ko, water permeability kw, etc

Value.title: Value
Value.description: The permeability value acting as a reference for this experiment.

PermeabilityMeasurementTypeID.title: Permeability Measurement Type ID
PermeabilityMeasurementTypeID.description: The type of permeability measurement being used as a reference value for this experiment.

SaturationProcessMethodID.title: Saturation Process Method ID
SaturationProcessMethodID.description: The method used to saturate the rock sample with a particular fluid in the experiment.

InterfacialTension.title: Interfacial Tension
InterfacialTension.description: The measured tension at the interface between the wetting and non-wetting phases during a test step.

BrineSalinity.title: Brine Salinity
BrineSalinity.description: The salinity level of the brine used in the test, affecting the rock's electrical resistivity properties.

OilViscosity.title: Oil Viscosity
OilViscosity.description: A measure of a fluid’s internal resistance to flow.

GasViscosity.title: Gas Viscosity
GasViscosity.description: A measure of a fluid’s internal resistance to flow.

WaterViscosity.title: Water Viscosity
WaterViscosity.description: A measure of a fluid’s internal resistance to flow.

OilDensity.title: Oil Density
OilDensity.description: The mass per volume of oil in the sample.

GasDensity.title: Gas Density
GasDensity.description: The mass per volume of gas in the sample.

WaterDensity.title: Water Density
WaterDensity.description: The mass per volume of water in the sample.

FluidSystemAnalysisTypeID.title: Fluid System Analysis Type ID
FluidSystemAnalysisTypeID.description: The type of fluid system in this analysis, e.g. gasbrine or gasoil.

items.title: Permeability Test Steps
items.description: The incremental test steps for this relative permeability experiment.

StartTime.title: Start Time
StartTime.description: The start time of this test step, typically in minutes.

DifferentialPressure.title: Differential Pressure
DifferentialPressure.description: The pressure difference or pressure gradient through the sample at equilibrium, also known as Delta P.

InjectionRate.title: Injection Rate
InjectionRate.description: The rate at which the fluid is injected into the sample.

items.title: Injection Rate
items.description: The rate at which the fluid is injected into the sample.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: Fluid Type injected into the sample.

CumulativeProduction.title: Cumulative Production
CumulativeProduction.description: The cumulative amount of fluid displaced from the sample

Value.title: Value
Value.description: The cumulative production value at this step.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: Fluid Type displaced from the sample due to injection

EffectivePermeability.title: Effective Permeability
EffectivePermeability.description: A measure of how easily fluids can flow through a porous sample, taking into consideration the saturation, presence of other fluids, and the interactions between those fluids into account.

items.title: Effective Permeability
items.description: A measure of how easily fluids can flow through a porous sample, taking into consideration the saturation, presence of other fluids, and the interactions between those fluids into account.

PermeabilityTypeID.title: Permeability Type ID
PermeabilityTypeID.description: The type of permeability being measured, e.g. Gas, PulseDecay, Klinkenberg.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used in determining effective permeability.

RelativePermeability.title: Relative Permeability
RelativePermeability.description: Relative permeability is a measure of how easily a particular fluid can flow through a porous medium when other fluids are also present.

items.title: Relative Permeability
items.description: Relative permeability is a measure of how easily a particular fluid can flow through a porous medium when other fluids are also present.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used in determining relative permeability.

Saturation.title: Saturation
Saturation.description: The extent to which pore space within the sample is filled with fluids.

FluidTypeID.title: Fluid Type ID
FluidTypeID.description: The fluid type used for this saturation.

SaturationTypeID.title: Saturation Type ID
SaturationTypeID.description: Identifies the area of focus for this saturation measurement, e.g. 'End Face' or 'Average'

InSituSaturationProfiles.title: In Situ Saturation Profiles
InSituSaturationProfiles.description: Captures water saturation values along the length of the core sample at time intervals.

items.title: In Situ Saturation Profiles
items.description: Captures saturation values along the length of the core sample at time intervals.

Time.title: Time
Time.description: The time at which the in-situ saturation was measured.

EquilibriumSaturation.title: Equilibrium Saturation
EquilibriumSaturation.description: The saturation value as measured at this timestamp.

DifferentialPressureProfiles.title: Differential Pressure Profiles
DifferentialPressureProfiles.description: Captures the differential pressure measured over time during the experiment.

items.title: Differential Pressure Profiles
items.description: Captures the differential pressure measured over time during the experiment.

Time.title: Time
Time.description: The time at which the pressure was measured.

ProductionProfiles.title: Production Profiles
ProductionProfiles.description: Stores data on fluid production over time.

items.title: Production Profiles
items.description: Captures data on fluid production over time.

Time.title: Time
Time.description: The time at which the pressure was measured.

FractionalFlowRate.title: Fractional Flow Rate
FractionalFlowRate.description: The fractional value of the injected fluid flow rate.

OilTypeID.title: Oil Type ID
OilTypeID.description: Identifies the type of oil used in the experiment.

GasTypeID.title: Gas Type ID
GasTypeID.description: Identifies the type of gas used in the experiment.

WaterTypeID.title: Water Type ID
WaterTypeID.description: Identifies the type of gas used in the experiment.
